post.text:
We’re excited to share that Stereo Biotherapeutics and Rime Therapeutics have been selected for the Merck Digital Sciences Studio (MDSS)! Stereo is working to improve the efficacy and developability of small-format soluble TCRs to address cellular heterogeneity in diseases, while Rime is focused on revolutionizing inflammation and immunology drug discovery. The fact that two Pre-Amp companies are among the seven startups chosen from a pool of 100+ applicants is a huge honor and an amazing accomplishment.

For those who don’t know, MDSS is a six-month accelerator in Montreal that helps digital health and AI startups fast-track their growth with expert mentorship, $100K in funding, and up to $150K in Azure credits. Plus, participating companies get direct access to Merck, CQDM and Centech Mtl's networks to help take their innovations in drug discovery to the next level.

A big congrats to both teams. We’re incredibly proud of the great work you’re doing!

comments.comment: Chris Ross, M.B.A. Hope all is well Chris!

post.text:
Please join us in welcoming Dallas Jones, Ph.D. as our new Senior Vice President, Biology at Tentarix!

Dallas brings a wealth of experience in drug discovery, spanning over 17 years across biotech, pharma, and venture creation. He’s held senior scientific leadership roles at Merck, Abide Therapeutics, Inception Therapeutics, and most recently CurieBio, where he played a key roles in driving innovative drug discovery programs, launching new portfolio companies, and guiding scientific strategy across a range of therapeutic areas.

With a strong foundation in immunology and oncology and a passion for translating cutting-edge science into real-world therapies, Dallas will lead our biology team as we continue to advance our pipeline of highly differentiated programs.

We’re thrilled to have Dallas on board as we continue building the future of conditional multispecific biologics at Tentarix!

author.description: Neurodegeneration Target and Discovery Leader at Eli Lilly and Company

recommendations.text:
I worked with Steve Demarest at Biogen Idec, where he heads up a Protein Engineering laboratory.  We interacted as colleagues in Research, as collaborators on projects, and in a customer-provider relationship when his group needed services from my Computational Biology group. 
Steve is a highly skilled and intelligent scientist, with the gracious demeanor of a natural leader.  He is knowledgeable about all aspects of protein/antibody engineering, and enthusiastic about using new technologies in this field.  During our time together at Biogen Idec, he spearheaded projects using  innovative computational techniques to improve antibody engineering.  The resulting computer tools, developed collaboratively by our groups, have given Biogen Idec phenomenal success at designing therapeutic antibodies.  This success is in large part due to Steve’s creativity and input as a member of a great team.
Steve’s scientific skills are augmented by his professional and open attitude toward coworkers at all levels.  These “soft skills” render him a terrific team member.  I found him to be a great pleasure to work with – trustworthy, balanced, and responsive – and I would welcome the chance to work together again.
recommendations.type: Lisa worked with Stephen but on different teams

post.text: I am deeply honored to be included on #ForbesOver50 list. This recognition needs to extend to all the wonderful colleagues and friends I have worked and interacted with over the years - thanks to you too 🙏 . Importantly, this is a moment to also celebrate and recognize every woman making a difference in their industry, in their work place, in their communities - I honor all of you ❤️!

author.description: Executive Vice President, Head of Research at Biogen

post.text: After more than three decades of service, Anne White will retire from Lilly at the end of this year. Anne’s leadership has left an indelible mark on our company—her vision, integrity, and commitment to patients have shaped who we are today. I’m personally grateful for her leadership and proud of all she’s accomplished. While we’ll miss her presence, Anne’s influence will continue to guide us for years to come. #WeAreLilly

post.text:
I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as Senior Vice President, Biotherapeutics at Tentarix Biotherapeutics! This milestone wouldn’t have been possible without the support of the amazing Biotherapeutics, Biology, ITS, Program Management, and GA teams—thank you for your hard work, collaboration, and constant inspiration.
I am also thankful to the Senior Leadership team for your guidance and trust.
Excited for the journey ahead to bring better medicines to the patients!

post.text:
We're thrilled to welcome Ash Khanna, Ph.D as our new Chief Business Officer at Tentarix!

Ash brings exceptional leadership experience as a founder and CBO at Vaxcyte and as a Venture Capital investor, most recently at Pivotal BioVentures. He brings deep expertise in Tentarix's core areas, combining strategy and financing with extensive business development experience including licensing deals, collaborations, and acquisitions.

With a strong foundation in R&D from his time at BMS following his PhD in pharmacology at SUNY, plus an MBA from Wharton, Ash will be instrumental as we advance our pipeline of highly differentiated Tentacles toward the clinic.

Ash will work closely with our leadership team to accelerate our mission of building the future of conditional multispecific biologics.
Proud of my daughter Kiersten Wasserman for starting her internship at Precision AQ! Great IR firm and wonderful opportunity

author.description: Senior Associate Scientist at Tentarix Biotherapeutics, Inc.

post.text: I love making these science displays for my kids’ elementary school (they rotate monthly and many parents contribute). This year, I focused on Paleontology (although Paleo-Immunology would have been just as interesting and more up my alley!). We painted the panels to help the kids visualize that a fossil can be found in an environment that was once so different from what we observe today, when that animal was alive. I hope to make these professions and fields of science feel accessible for these young kids and give them some tangible action items for today to get them where they aspire to go! 🦕 🧬 🧪

author.description: Director, Cell Biology at Tentarix Biotherapeutics, Inc.

post.text: I’m thrilled to be joining Senti Bioscences’ Scientific Advisory Board.  I’ve followed Senti’s science since we both worked in JLabs SSF incubator. I’ve been consistently impressed by the quality of their program, at the care and rigor of their entire development strategy, and most of all by the excellence of their team.  I’m honored to be working with them!

post.text:
Tentarix Team Takes on the Hot Chocolate Run! 🐙☕

Keeping up with the Tentarix Team is no small feat! The Tentarix Running Club recently took on the challenge of the Hot Chocolate 5k & 10k in downtown San Diego!

Twelve of our team members showed up strong, and three even finished in the top 5 of their divisions! 

At Tentarix, we appreciate that the same dedication and teamwork our team brings to the lab shows up in their support of each other in their outside adventures!

Congrats to all the racers for representing Tentarix with pride! 🐙

#Teamwork #Biotech #Tentarix #STEM #Wellness #Community

We’re delighted to welcome Tim Noffke as our new Vice President, Program Management and Chief of Staff!

Tim brings more than 25 years of biotech and pharma experience, including leadership roles at Pfizer, Hospira, and multiple clinical-stage biotechs. At Tentarix, he’ll serve as a key strategic partner to our leadership team - helping to shape and execute our vision, lead long-range program planning, and accelerate initiatives critical to our pipeline and growth.

From post-DC to IND and beyond, Tim will be instrumental as we advance our pipeline of highly differentiated Tentacles toward the clinic.

Please join us in giving Tim a warm welcome to the Tentarix team as we continue to explore the future of conditional biologics together!

Save the Date: Bonum will be at #BIO2025! 📅 Join our own Neela Patel and industry peers for “Beyond ADCs and Bispecifics: Conditionally Active Biologics," on June 18 at 10:15 AM.

Moderator: 
·  Michael Rice, MS, MBA, Expert Advisor, SPV, Cell and Gene Therapy, Lumanity

Panelists:
· Alexandra Cantley, PhD, Partner, Polaris Partners 
· Stephen Demarest, PhD, CSO, Tentarix Biotherapeutics
· Randi Isaacs, MD, CMO, Werewolf Therapeutics
· Neela Patel, PhD, CBO, Bonum Therapeutics
· Emmett Schmidt, VP, Clinical Development, Merck 

See you there!

#TheWorldCantWait
Biotechnology Innovation Organization

I am honored to announce my candidacy for President-elect of the American Statistical Association - ASA !

I have been part of the ASA for decades.  It’s been a venue for serving and collaborating with so many colleagues— students, early career professionals, and beyond — and an anchor throughout my statistics career.  I can’t think of a larger honor than being nominated to serve ASA in this capacity. 

I would appreciate your support. 

A few words about how I will lead in this role, if elected:

— with a **listening posture**.   All ideas can be made better through listening and collaboration.  This is at the core of how I lead.  It’s also a direct acknowledgment that ASA members have many great ideas which need to be heard, and that ASA history carries significant learnings that need to be referenced in decision making.

— with a **sense of optimism**.   Despite the rapid pace of change and ‘disruption,’ ASA has the ability to meet these challenges as opportunities, adapting at pace.  This begins with the immense talent of ASA volunteers and employees.

— with **active collaboration **.  This is at the core of how I lead and serve.  I will bring this spirit with an eye towards collaboration across sectors, etc to deliver on ASA’s mission.

For my thoughts on areas of focus for my term ( **Advocacy**, **Telling Our Story**, **Ensuring organizational health**, and **Equipping and Cultivating Leaders**), please visit my website.  https://lnkd.in/gxtzKddT.  There you can leave me questions or ideas and view more about my background.

The Election begins April 1st.   I would appreciate your vote.

author.description: Global Statistics Leader in Pharmaceutical Industry | Clinical Trials Statistics and Innovation | Real World Analytics and Med Affairs & Access Statistics | Elected Officer, Amer. Stat. Assoc. | Servant Leader

author.description: Chief Financial Officer

post.text:
"In the future, there will be no female leaders. There will just be leaders" - Sheryl Sandberg's aspirational quote reminds us of the goal, but also the journey. On International Women's Day, I'm reflecting on the remarkable achievements of women in Biotech – the thriving #CEOsisterhood and #CFOsisterhood, and the growing presence of women in Boardrooms.

While we celebrate progress, we must continue to focus on creating inclusive environments where diverse perspectives thrive. I'm grateful for the leaders who are actively building this future. #IWD2024 💪

post.text:
Employee Spotlight: Monideepa Sengupta, Ph.D, Senior Scientist

Monideepa is a driving force in advancing our therapeutic platform at Tentarix through innovative in-vivo pharmacology. Recently, she found a way to speed up a critical process, transforming timelines from weeks to just days—and helping us push key programs forward faster!

“I’m driven by impactful innovation that has the potential to change lives. Working at the forefront of biologics, it’s inspiring to know our work makes a difference.”

Outside the lab, she recharges on outdoor adventures with her two dogs. 🐾

#Biologics #Biotech #EmployeeSpotlight
